definitions: having a thick, sticky consistency between solid and liquid that flows slowly
examples: The viscous honey dripped slowly from the spoon
Motor oil becomes less viscous at high temperatures

definitions: showing exceptional imagination and foresight in planning for the future with original ideas
relating to or characterized by supernatural visions or mystical experiences
examples: The visionary entrepreneur predicted smartphones before they existed
Her visionary leadership transformed the struggling company completely
The prophet had visionary experiences during deep meditation
Medieval saints often reported visionary encounters with angels

definitions: having been formed into a mental image or made visible through representation
examples: The architect visualized the building before drawing plans
She visualized success to boost her confidence levels

definitions: filled with bitter criticism or malice that is extremely harsh and caustic
examples: His vitriolic attack on opponents shocked the audience
The review contained vitriolic comments about the performance

definitions: attractively lively and animated with high spirits and enthusiasm for life
examples: The vivacious hostess kept everyone entertained all evening
Her vivacious personality made her popular among colleagues

definitions: producing powerful feelings or strong, clear images through intense brightness or color
producing clear and detailed mental images that are easy to remember
examples: The sunset painted vivid oranges across the sky
Artists use vivid colors to capture viewers' attention
She had vivid memories of her childhood home
The author's vivid descriptions brought scenes to life

definitions: relating to an occupation or employment requiring specific skills and training
examples: Students enrolled in vocational programs learn practical skills
The vocational school offers courses in automotive repair

definitions: expressing opinions or feelings in a very loud and forceful way
examples: The crowd made vociferous demands for political change
Her vociferous objections disrupted the entire meeting yesterday

definitions: expressed verbally or communicated through spoken words rather than remaining silent
produced with vibration of the vocal cords in phonetics
examples: She voiced concerns about the new company policy
The committee voiced strong support for the proposal
In English, 'b' is a voiced consonant sound
Voiced sounds use vocal cord vibration during pronunciation

definitions: produced without vibration of the vocal cords in speech sounds
lacking the power or opportunity to express opinions or influence decisions
examples: The letter 'p' is a voiceless consonant sound
Voiceless sounds don't vibrate the vocal cords
The voiceless minorities struggled for representation in government
Many feel voiceless in today's political climate discussions

definitions: completely empty with nothing inside creating an unfilled space or vacuum
having no legal force or effect making something null and invalid
examples: The warehouse stood void of any remaining inventory
Her heart felt void after the painful breakup
The contract was declared void due to fraud
Your warranty becomes void if you modify equipment

definitions: liable to change rapidly and unpredictably especially for the worse
evaporating readily at normal temperatures and pressures in chemistry
examples: The volatile stock market worried many cautious investors
His volatile temper made coworkers uncomfortable around him
Gasoline is a volatile liquid requiring careful storage
Volatile organic compounds contribute to air pollution problems

definitions: relating to or produced by volcanoes or volcanic activity
examples: The volcanic eruption destroyed several nearby villages completely
Scientists study volcanic rock to understand Earth's history

definitions: occupying or containing much space with great volume or bulk
examples: She wore a voluminous gown to the formal event
The researcher compiled voluminous notes during the study

definitions: done, given, or acting of one's own free will without compulsion
examples: She made voluntary contributions to several local charities
Participation in the program is completely voluntary for students

definitions: having a curvaceous and sexually attractive figure with full rounded forms
relating to or characterized by luxury and sensual pleasure
examples: The painting depicted a voluptuous figure in silk
Fashion designers created dresses for voluptuous body types
They enjoyed the voluptuous comfort of the spa
The voluptuous feast satisfied all their culinary desires

definitions: wanting or devouring great quantities of food with an insatiable appetite
examples: The voracious teenager emptied the entire refrigerator quickly
Sharks are voracious predators in the ocean ecosystem

definitions: offered or consecrated in fulfillment of a vow or religious promise
examples: She lit votive candles at the church altar
The ancient temple contained many votive offerings displayed

definitions: lacking sophistication or good taste and considered unrefined or coarse
making explicit reference to bodily functions or sexual matters offensively
examples: His vulgar display of wealth offended many guests
The vulgar decorations clashed with the elegant venue
The comedian's vulgar jokes made audiences uncomfortable tonight
Parents complained about vulgar language in the movie

definitions: funny or amusing in an odd, unconventional, or slightly crazy way
examples: The wacky professor wore mismatched socks every single day
Her wacky sense of humor kept friends constantly laughing

definitions: giving a prolonged high-pitched cry of pain, grief, or anger
examples: The wailing sirens announced the emergency vehicle's approach
We heard wailing sounds coming from the haunted house

definitions: staying in a place or delaying action until something happens
examples: The waiting passengers grew impatient at the gate
She spent hours in the hospital's waiting room

definitions: relating to the state of being awake rather than sleeping
examples: He spent his waking hours thinking about work
The baby's waking moments were filled with curiosity

definitions: looking pale and giving the impression of illness or exhaustion
examples: Her wan appearance worried her family and friends
He gave a wan smile despite feeling very sick

definitions: moving slowly without a fixed course or destination in an aimless way
examples: The wandering travelers explored villages along their journey
His wandering thoughts made concentration difficult during class

definitions: showing a gradual decrease in size, strength, or intensity over time
examples: Her waning enthusiasm for the project concerned managers
The waning moon appeared smaller each successive night

definitions: wished for or desired by someone as needed or useful
examples: The wanted criminal was captured after months hiding
She felt wanted and appreciated at her job

definitions: lacking in a certain required or necessary quality or element
examples: The performance was wanting in enthusiasm and energy
They found the security measures wanting after inspection

definitions: deliberate and unprovoked showing no justification or restraint in actions
lustful or sexually unrestrained showing promiscuous behavior
examples: The wanton destruction of property shocked the community
Critics condemned the wanton disregard for safety regulations
The novel depicted wanton behavior at lavish parties
Historical accounts described the king's wanton lifestyle choices

definitions: disposed toward or threatening war with hostile and aggressive characteristics
examples: The warlike tribes constantly fought over territorial boundaries
His warlike attitude made peaceful negotiations extremely difficult

definitions: having been made warm or warmer by heating or other means
examples: The warmed soup tasted much better than cold
She felt warmed by their kind words of support

definitions: bent or twisted out of shape typically from heat or dampness
having ideas or thoughts that are strange, unpleasant, or unreasonable
examples: The warped wood couldn't be used for construction
Heat caused the plastic container to become warped
His warped sense of humor disturbed many people
Years of isolation created a warped worldview perspective

definitions: engaged in war or conflict between opposing groups or nations
examples: The warring factions finally agreed to peace talks
History books describe centuries of warring European kingdoms

definitions: covered with warts or wart-like protrusions on the surface
examples: The warty toad camouflaged perfectly among rough rocks
Dermatologists can treat warty growths with various methods

definitions: feeling or showing caution about possible dangers or problems ahead
examples: Investors remained wary of the volatile stock market
The cat was wary of strangers entering the house

definitions: cleaned with water and typically soap or detergent to remove dirt
having color that appears faded or diluted as if by washing
examples: The washed dishes sparkled in the drying rack
Her washed hair smelled fresh like spring flowers
The washed denim jacket had a vintage appearance
Years of sun created a washed look naturally

definitions: used or expended carelessly or to no purpose causing unnecessary loss
suffering from extreme weight loss appearing unhealthily thin and weak
examples: He wasted countless hours playing video games daily
The wasted food could have fed hungry families
The illness left him looking wasted and frail
Drug addiction had left her wasted beyond recognition

definitions: using or expending resources carelessly, extravagantly, or to no purpose
examples: The wasteful packaging used excessive plastic and cardboard
Their wasteful spending habits led to financial problems

definitions: watching or observing someone or something closely and alertly for danger
examples: The watchful guard monitored all entrance points carefully
Parents kept watchful eyes on children near water

definitions: conveyed by, traveling on, or involving travel or transport on water
examples: Waterborne diseases spread through contaminated drinking water sources
The waterborne cargo arrived at port this morning

definitions: supplied with water for plants or animals to maintain growth
diluted or weakened by adding water to reduce strength
examples: The watered garden bloomed beautifully throughout the summer
Farmers ensured crops were properly watered during drought
The watered wine tasted weak and lacked flavor
He complained his drink had been watered down

definitions: saturated with water to the point of being heavy and sodden
examples: The waterlogged field was too muddy for playing
Heavy rains left the basement carpet completely waterlogged

definitions: impervious to water preventing any water from entering or passing through
examples: The waterproof jacket kept her dry during storms
Smartphones now come with waterproof cases for protection

definitions: closely sealed, fastened, or fitted so that no water enters or passes through
without loopholes or exceptions making something impossible to dispute or fault
examples: The watertight container kept documents safe from flooding
Ships require watertight doors between compartments for safety
Lawyers drafted a watertight contract covering all possibilities
The prosecution built a watertight case against defendant

definitions: containing a large amount of water or too much water
weak, pale, or thin in consistency, color, or strength
examples: The watery soup needed more vegetables and seasoning
Her watery eyes showed she'd been crying recently
The painting used watery colors for subtle effects
He gave a watery smile through his obvious pain

definitions: showing indecision or uncertainty between different opinions or actions
moving unsteadily or shakily in a quivering way
examples: His wavering commitment to the project concerned teammates
The wavering voter couldn't decide between two candidates
The candle flame was wavering in the breeze
Her wavering voice revealed how nervous she felt

definitions: having a form or outline that curves back and forth
examples: Her wavy hair bounced as she walked down stairs
The artist drew wavy lines to represent ocean water

definitions: treated with wax for protection, waterproofing, or to give shine
gradually increased in size, number, strength, or intensity
examples: The waxed floor gleamed under the bright lights
His waxed mustache curled upward at both ends
Her enthusiasm waxed as the project progressed successfully
The moon waxed fuller each night until full

definitions: undergoing a gradual increase in size, number, strength, or intensity
examples: The waxing moon grew brighter each passing night
His waxing influence in politics worried his opponents

definitions: having a smooth, shiny surface or consistency resembling wax
examples: The waxy leaves helped the plant retain moisture
Some cheeses develop a waxy coating during aging
